thread.title: ‘A Spy in the House of Loud’ Review: Notes on CBGB, the dB’s and R.E.M.

author: Tony Fletcher
title: ‘A Spy in the House of Loud’ Review: Notes on CBGB, the dB’s and R.E.M.
text:
Chris Stamey is a musician’s musician. That’s the nice way of saying that, while he enjoys great respect among his peers for his influential 1970s and ’80s bands the Sneakers and the dB’s, as well as his work as a solo artist and producer, he has little name recognition with the wider music-buying public.
As an author, Mr. Stamey faces a similar dilemma. In “A Spy in the House of Loud: New York Songs and Stories,” he blends his music-composition education with his degree in philosophy to produce a book that demonstrates his...
